title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: The carriage came round tothe door; and the maid-servant having put theminister's greatcoat into the vehicle and slammedthe door, the coachman, thinking this was theminister himself, drove off, and never discoveredthe mistake till he arrived at Ashkirk, and foundno minister there ! The Doctor, apprised of thecircumstances, had to borrow a horse, and rideas fast as possible after the runaway wheels.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: In speaking of some of my father's contemporariesin the Presbytery, I begin with Mr Haliburton,1minister of Ashkirk, an old bachelor—his housekeeper being his sister Miss Peggy, as simpleminded as himself.

snippet: It was not, however, till the forenoon of a Fast-day, when he hadridden across the hills to preach at Ashkirk, thattheir fate was sealed.

author: Grant, James
snippet: Then were banners displayed and lances lifted; andAngus and Ashkirk feared not to bend their cannonagainst the royal castle of Edinburgh, where the youngking, the queen-mother, and their prime minister wereresiding.
